creator: Aminimal
title: Designing the Optimal Bow with Dreamcatcher
materials_required: Haas Mill (or equivalent CNC milling machine)
description: This project outlines the process of designing an optimized bow using generative design software (Dreamcatcher) and 3D scanning techniques. The resulting design is then fabricated using 3D milling.
steps: Research different cultural archery styles and develop a passion for the project.
3D scan an existing recurve bow and your hand using an Artec Eva 3D scanner to capture the geometry and points of interest.
Rebuild the 3D information and points of interest in Dreamcatcher, defining connection points, load cases, and void objects. Specify aluminum as the material.
Input the data into Dreamcatcher and allow the software to generate an optimized design based on the specified parameters.
Export the optimized design and fabricate the final piece using a 3D milling process (e.g., on a Haas Mill with a flip technique).
Test and use the bow for archery.
